objectives: Evaluate different viewpoints on injuries and accidents
Create original dialogues about injuries and accidents

multiple_intelligences.linguistic: Write a story or essay about injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.logical_mathematical: Analyze patterns and create logical arguments about injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.spatial: Create visual representations or mind maps of injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.bodily_kinesthetic: Role-play or act out scenarios related to injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.musical: Create a song or rhythm exercise about injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.interpersonal: Collaborate in groups to discuss injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.intrapersonal: Reflect individually on personal connection to injuries and accidents
multiple_intelligences.naturalistic: Categorize and classify concepts related to injuries and accidents

content.basic: Simplified texts and basic vocabulary about injuries and accidents
content.intermediate: Standard complexity materials with support about injuries and accidents
content.advanced: Complex authentic materials and academic texts about injuries and accidents

process.grouping: Individual, pairs, small groups, or whole class based on preference
process.choice: Multiple activity options aligned with learning style

differentiation.environment: Quiet space with good acoustics and audio equipment

warm_up.description: Students listen to audio about injuries and accidents and share reactions

main_activities.description: Students receive information about injuries and accidents through auditory modality
Students practice language related to injuries and accidents using auditory approach
Students produce original content about injuries and accidents demonstrating advanced thinking

discussion_prompts: What are the implications of injuries and accidents for society?
How would you design a better approach to injuries and accidents?
What criteria would you use to evaluate injuries and accidents?

vocabulary_support.tier_2: Academic and topic-specific words for injuries and accidents
vocabulary_support.tier_3: Domain-specific technical terms related to injuries and accidents

homework_options.required: Core assignment at advanced level using auditory approach

teacher_notes.grouping_suggestions: Flexible grouping based on readiness and interest
teacher_notes.time_management: Build in flexibility for different pacing needs

common_difficulties: Students may lack background knowledge about injuries and accidents
Vocabulary may be challenging for some students
Some students may need more processing time
methodology: UDL + Differentiated Instruction + CLT + Multiple Intelligences
references: CAST Universal Design for Learning Guidelines
